habits.title: Daily Vitamin D3 (2000-4000 IU)
habits.description: Take vitamin D3 supplement with breakfast for energy and mood
habits.instructions:
1. Take 2000-4000 IU vitamin D3 with your first meal of the day
2. Store supplements in a visible location as reminder
3. Set phone reminder if needed
4. Consider blood test after 3 months to check levels
habits.whyEffective: 80%+ of people are vitamin D deficient, especially in Northern Europe. Supplementation improves mood, energy, immune function, and cognitive performance.
habits.contraindications: Consult doctor if taking calcium supplements or have kidney issues. Start with lower dose if sensitive.

habits.title: Daily Omega-3 (EPA/DHA 1000mg+)
habits.description: Take high-quality fish oil or algae omega-3 for brain health
habits.instructions:
1. Take 1000-2000mg combined EPA/DHA with a meal containing fat
2. Choose high-quality, tested brand (check for heavy metals testing)
3. Store in refrigerator to prevent rancidity
4. Take consistently - benefits build over time
habits.whyEffective: Modern diets severely lack omega-3 fatty acids. EPA/DHA are essential for brain function, mood regulation, and reducing inflammation.
habits.contraindications: Consult doctor if taking blood thinners. May cause mild digestive upset initially.

habits.title: Evening Magnesium (200-400mg)
habits.description: Take magnesium glycinate before bed for sleep and recovery
habits.instructions:
1. Take 200-400mg magnesium glycinate 1-2 hours before bed
2. Avoid magnesium oxide (poor absorption)
3. Start with 200mg, increase gradually if needed
4. Take with small amount of food if stomach sensitive
habits.whyEffective: Most people are magnesium deficient due to soil depletion and processed foods. Magnesium improves sleep quality, reduces stress, and aids muscle recovery.
habits.contraindications: Reduce dose if experiencing loose stools. Avoid if taking certain medications.

habits.title: 10-Minute Morning Sunlight
habits.description: Get direct sunlight exposure within 1 hour of waking
habits.instructions:
1. Go outside within 1 hour of waking up
2. Look toward (not directly at) the sun for 10-15 minutes
3. No sunglasses during this exposure time
4. If cloudy, increase to 20-30 minutes
5. Combine with morning walk, coffee, or breakfast outside
habits.whyEffective: Light exposure within 1 hour of waking sets your circadian rhythm, improves sleep quality, boosts mood, and increases daytime energy levels.
habits.contraindications: None for normal exposure times. Don't stare directly at sun.

habits.title: 30g+ Protein at Breakfast
habits.description: Include 30+ grams of protein in your first meal
habits.instructions:
1. Include 30+ grams protein: 4 eggs, Greek yogurt + protein powder, or lean meat
2. Eat within 1-2 hours of waking
3. Pair with complex carbs and healthy fats
4. Track protein content initially to build awareness
5. Prepare options in advance for busy mornings
habits.whyEffective: High protein breakfast stabilizes blood sugar, reduces afternoon cravings, maintains muscle mass, and improves cognitive function throughout the day.
habits.contraindications: Adjust portions if kidney issues. Spread protein if digestive sensitive.

habits.title: No Screens 1 Hour Before Bed
habits.description: Create screen-free wind-down period before sleep
habits.instructions:
1. Set all devices to 'Do Not Disturb' 1 hour before intended sleep time
2. Charge phone outside bedroom
3. Use analog alarm clock instead of phone
4. Replace screen time with reading, stretching, or meditation
5. Use blue light blocking glasses if screens absolutely necessary
habits.whyEffective: Blue light from screens suppresses melatonin production and disrupts circadian rhythm. Removing screens dramatically improves sleep onset and quality.
habits.contraindications: None. May require adjustment period for habits.

habits.title: Daily Creatine (3-5g)
habits.description: Take creatine monohydrate for cognitive and physical performance
habits.instructions:
1. Take 3-5g creatine monohydrate daily
2. Mix with water, juice, or protein shake
3. Timing doesn't matter - consistency is key
4. No loading phase needed with daily dosing
5. Increase water intake throughout day
habits.whyEffective: Creatine improves cognitive performance, working memory, reduces mental fatigue, and enhances physical performance. Benefits both brain and muscle energy.
habits.contraindications: Increase water intake significantly. May cause initial 1-2kg water weight gain.

habits.title: 5-Minute Box Breathing
habits.description: Structured breathing exercise for stress reduction and focus
habits.instructions:
1. Sit comfortably with straight spine
2. Inhale for 4 counts through nose
3. Hold breath for 4 counts
4. Exhale for 4 counts through mouth
5. Hold empty for 4 counts
6. Repeat for 10-20 cycles (about 5 minutes)
habits.whyEffective: Box breathing activates the parasympathetic nervous system, reduces cortisol levels, improves heart rate variability, and enhances focus and decision-making.
habits.contraindications: Reduce hold times if feeling dizzy. Stop if experiencing discomfort.

habits.title: 2-Minute Cold Shower Finish
habits.description: End shower with 2 minutes of cold water for resilience
habits.instructions:
1. Take normal warm shower first
2. Turn water to cold (15-20°C) for final 2 minutes
3. Focus on deep, controlled breathing throughout
4. Start with 30 seconds, build up gradually over weeks
5. Exit shower immediately after to maintain body warmth
habits.whyEffective: Cold exposure increases norepinephrine levels, improves mood and focus, builds stress resilience, and may boost immune function through hormetic stress.
habits.contraindications: Avoid with heart conditions, during illness, or if pregnant. Build tolerance gradually.

habits.title: Write 3 Specific Gratitudes
habits.description: Write three specific things you're grateful for each day
habits.instructions:
1. Write (don't just think) 3 specific things you're grateful for
2. Be specific: 'my partner made coffee' not 'my partner'
3. Include why you're grateful for each item
4. Focus on people and experiences over material things
5. Use same notebook or app consistently for habit building
habits.whyEffective: Regular gratitude practice rewires the brain for positivity, improves mood and relationships, increases life satisfaction, and reduces stress and depression.
habits.contraindications: None. May feel forced initially but becomes natural with practice.

habits.title: 16-24oz Water Upon Waking
habits.description: Drink large glass of water immediately upon waking
habits.instructions:
1. Keep 500-700ml water glass by bedside
2. Drink immediately upon waking, before coffee or tea
3. Add pinch of sea salt for electrolytes (optional)
4. Room temperature or slightly warm is easiest to drink
5. Wait 15-30 minutes before eating breakfast
habits.whyEffective: Rehydrates body after 7-8 hours without fluids, jumpstarts metabolism, aids kidney function, and improves cognitive performance for morning tasks.
habits.contraindications: None. Adjust amount if it causes urgent bathroom needs.

habits.title: Hourly Posture Check + Stretch
habits.description: Set hourly reminder to check and correct posture
habits.instructions:
1. Set hourly phone reminder during work hours (9am-5pm)
2. Check posture: feet flat, shoulders back, ears over shoulders
3. Do 30-second neck and shoulder stretch
4. Take 5 deep breaths while maintaining good posture
5. Adjust workspace ergonomics as needed
habits.whyEffective: Regular posture breaks prevent musculoskeletal problems, improve energy levels, reduce chronic pain, and enhance breathing capacity and confidence.
habits.contraindications: None. Adjust reminder frequency if disruptive to work flow.
